intro: Scrophularia canina var. crithmifolia, commonly known as dog's mouth thyme, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring hairy stems and opposite leaves with a slightly serrated margin. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, arranged in spikes, and bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
